section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: If you don't have one of these installed on your system, you must download and install it to compile and run the software.

section.title: Installation
section.p: Download CZT from Sourceforge, unpack it and change into the installation directory.
Customise the file czt.properties to the location of your installed software.
Run ant. If this is not working report a bug at Sourceforge.

section.title: Quick Start
section.p: Currently, the best way to explore CZT is to use the beanshell console and try the various CZT commands provided in CZT_HOME/bin/bsh. To do this just install CZT and call the script beanshell which is located in CZT_HOME/bin. You should now get a beanshell console window, where you can type your commands. Make sure to call importCommands("bsh"); to get access to the CZT commands.
An examples session could look like this (please substitute CZT_HOME with your CZT home directory):
section.source: BeanShell 2.0b1.1 - by Pat Niemeyer (pat@pat.net) bsh % importCommands("bsh"); bsh % cd("CZT_HOME/examples/z"); bsh % term = unmarshal("eg1.xml"); // unmarshal an example file bsh % print(term); // print the root of the AST net.sourceforge.czt.z.impl.SpecImpl@a15dfd30 bsh % print(term.getVersion()); // show the version of the Spec 1.1 bsh % print(toLatex(term)); // transform the AST to LaTex \begin{zed} ...
